perturbation.original_text:
(c) Party B shall ensure the vehicles are in good conditions, the compartments are properly sealed without leakage and the vehicles are
equipped with fire-fighting equipment. In the event of parcel damage resulting from leakage or fire, Party B shall indemnify at the
standard rate of RMB200 per parcel, and indemnify the actual price for high-end insured parcel (or indemnify by the value of the
parcel provided by arbitration department determined by Party A).
perturbation.changed_text:
(c) Party B shall ensure the vehicles are in good conditions, the compartments are properly sealed without leakage and the vehicles are
equipped with fire-fighting equipment. In the event of parcel damage resulting from leakage or fire, Party B shall provide some compensation.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific compensation amount of RMB200 per parcel and the method for high-end insured parcels, the modified text creates uncertainty regarding the extent of Party B's liability. The remaining phrase 'provide some compensation' is vague and unenforceable. Other clauses may rely on a fixed indemnity, creating an internal contradiction if they reference a standard compensation rate which no longer exists in the modified section.

perturbation.original_text:
(e) Party B shall arrive at the network partners determined by Party A according to the time and route stipulated in this Agreement, and
strictly comply with the start time and end time. Unless otherwise approved by Party A, in the event of parcel transfer due to
Party B’s vehicle delay, Party B shall pay liquidated damages to Party A at the standard rate of RMB500 per trip on the first
working day, RMB1,000 per trip on the second working day and RMB2,000 per trip on the third working day (based on the time
records on the parcel transfer documents) and such liquidated damages will be deducted from the current month’s freight. In the
special event of changes to route and time and severe weather (or other force majeure events), Party B shall be in touch with
Party A in time and record such special event on the parcel transfer documents with Party A’s approval.
perturbation.changed_text:
(e) Party B shall arrive at the network partners determined by Party A according to the time and route stipulated in this Agreement, and
strictly comply with the start time and end time. Unless otherwise approved by Party A, in the event of parcel transfer due to
Party B’s vehicle delay, Party B shall pay some penalty to Party A. In the
special event of changes to route and time and severe weather (or other force majeure events), Party B shall be in touch with
Party A in time and record such special event on the parcel transfer documents with Party A’s approval.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing the specific liquidated damages amounts (RMB500, RMB1,000, RMB2,000) with 'some penalty,' the modified text removes the established financial consequences of delays. This creates ambiguity and renders the enforcement of delay penalties uncertain. Other sections referencing 'liquidated damages' based on the old calculation now contradict this section which only mandates 'some penalty' without quantification.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B may face some penalty as a result of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.
perturbation.explanation: The change replaces the defined 'one-month freight as liquidated damages' with 'may face some penalty,' removing the concrete financial obligation for early termination without consent. This creates significant ambiguity and makes the enforcement of penalties for early termination difficult. If the contract refers to liquidated damages in a specific financial amount, this now contradicts it.
